author: Anonymous Calc
title: filter
question: Does filter always put the numbers in ascending order? What if the question was asking us to put it in descending order?
instructor_answer:
Filter's not the function putting our numbers in ascending order, it's the fact that we're appending our lists in the order of 
(append (qsort (filter <p? lon))
                   (list p)
                   (qsort (filter >p? lon)))
You can reverse the numbers by switching your two recursive calls!
(append (qsort (filter >p? lon))
                   (list p)
                   (qsort (filter <p? lon)))
Filter preserves the order of the elements they originally came in, they just throw some of em out according to the predicate 😊
